newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU has no comment on DT 's prices complaint.
newsitem.headline: EU has no comment on DT 's prices complaint.

text.p: The European Commission had no immediate comment on Friday on a reported complaint against Deutsche Telekom's tariff rebates policy saying it had not received it.
"We have not received anything," the spokesman for European Competition Commissioner Karel Van Miert told reporters.

The Commission would first need to have the complaint and see whether the German government and Telekom will respect the conditions for implementing the discounts to companies on November 1, Commission sources said.
German industry sources quoted by Reuters late on Thursday said Deutsche Telekom's rivals had urged the Commission to revise its June decision clearing Telekom's new business customer tariffs.

The rival companies are the same that complained to the Commission at the beginning of the year against the rebates of up to 49 percent arguing that Deutsche Telekom was abusing its dominant position to try to squeeze new competitors out of the market.

They are Communications Network International, Thyssen subsidiary Plus Net, Veba 's Meganet, RWE Telliance AG, WorldCom Inc and Viag Intercom. The companies were expected to outline their complaint at a news conference on Friday in Duesseldorf.

The Commission said in June that before Telekom's new tariff policy came into force, the German government should have granted two licences for the construction or ownership of alternative telecoms infrastructure such as those operated by utility companies.
It also stressed a commitment given by Bonn that it would ensure that Deutsche Telekom engaged in negotiations with rival players on access to Telekom's public switched network.

The Commission sources were not entirely aware whether those conditions would be met, but guessed that the complaining parties might be unhappy with the results of the talks on interconnection tariffs. -- Amelia Torres 322 2876841
